p: There was also a significant reduction in total nitrogen (above- plus below-ground) in burned compared to unburned plants (F = 6.164, p = 0.016). There was a significant reduction in % N belowground in burned trees compared to unburned trees (F = 5.500, p = 0.023) (control trees = 1.17 ± 0.078%; burned trees = 0.88 ± 0.062%) but not % aboveground nitrogen (F = 2.419, p = 0.126).
